results.title: Winnie the Pooh and the blustery day (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Wolfgang Reitherman
results.brief_description: A blustery wind sweeps through the Hundred Acre Wood, toppling Owl’s tree home, and making everyone, especially Pooh, very uneasy.

results.title: Winnie the Pooh and Christmas too
results.brief_description: Christopher Robin and the other favourites in the Hundred Acre Wood are disappointed when they realise they have no way to get their Christmas wish list to Santa Claus. That’s when Winnie the Pooh decides to deliver the list himself and sets off on a quest to save Christmas. Also includes two other stories - “Tigger is the mother of invention” and “Magic Earmuffs”.

results.title: Winnie the Pooh
results.brief_description: 1. Kanga and Roo come to the forest. 2. Pooh invents a new game and Eeyore joins in. 3. Rabbit has a busy day, and we learn what Christopher Robin does in the morning. 4. Christopher Robin and Pooh come to an enchanted place, and we leave them there.

results.title: Winner: Problem solving - measurement
results.brief_description: Animated film which visualizes the concept of measurement and rates. Illustrates the usefulness of constructing scale models to estimate a solution. Demonstrates how to use a calculator to compare data and solve problems.

results.title: Wings: the jet age
results.brief_description: Here at last is the collector’s video encyclopaedia of aviation, featuring over 100 modern aircraft. Using truly spectacular airborne sequences and rare archival footage, this video traces the meteoric progress in civil and military jet aircraft from World War II to state of the art super-sonic planes. Thrill to intricate formation aerobatics by the RAF Red Arrows and US Blue Angels demonstration teams, and witness dynamic inflight refuelling procedures. This fascinating programme provides a wealth of knowledge on a multitude of aircraft designs and technology, as well as flight procedure, equipment and instrumentation.

results.title: Wings: a tale of two chickens
results.brief_description: Harriet the chicken reads voraciously and has a multitude of hobbies, while her friend Winnie swats flies, and constantly searches for a good time. One day the suave fox, Mr. Johnson, appears with a hot air balloon, promising to show Winnie a good time. Winnie decides to “live a little”, and takes him up on his offer, much to Harriet’s horror. While Harriet contacts the police, Mr. Johnston makes a stop at the grocery store to pick up some dumplings to go with his chicken dinner. Harriet accidentally throws the weights overboard, and the balloon sails off. Mr. Johnston does not give up so easily, donning a chicken costume, he lures Harriet away from the safety of her home. Will Harriet become the main course for Mr. Johnson’s dinner, or will her resourceful friend Winnie be able to outwit the crafty fox before it’s too late? A cautionary tale about the importance of reading, based on the book by James Marshall.

results.title: Wings under test
results.creator_credit: Council for Scientific and Industrial Research (Australia). Information Service and S.T. Evans
results.brief_description: A summarized version is included in a later film entitled “Structural fatigue and air safety”. The method and equipment developed by the Division of Aeronautics to test large aircraft wings for airworthiness requirements, resistance to fatigue and ultimate static strength.

results.title: Wings to the future
results.brief_description: Principle features and event of the 1962 Farmborough Air Show. British aircraft on display included the Hawker P-1277, Bristol Type 188, Vickers VC10, de Havilland Trident, de Havilland 125 jet and the Beagle 218. Many others craft are seen on the ground and in the air, and supersonic fighters of the Armed Services give a thrilling display of aerobatics as a finale.

results.title: Wings to Italy
results.creator_credit: Ideal Pictures (US), Coleman Productions and Harry L. Coleman
results.brief_description: Points of interest ot the tourist in Italy are seen as a young couple reminisce about their vacation trip. Includes Rome, Vesuvius, Pompeii, Capri, Pisa, Siena, Florence, the Dolomites and Venice.
